intro: Minuartia urumiensis, commonly known as the Urumi sand-flower, is a low-growing, perennial plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of South Asia, particularly in India and Pakistan. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Minuartia urumiensis thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or rocky outcrops.
